channel.title: Essays :: Danielle Navarro
channel.description: Recent content on Essays :: Danielle Navarro

item.title: Still the same
item.description: I am haunted by a terribly pedestrian phrase.

item.title: A last goodnight
item.description: Sometimes you have to learn to let go.

item.title: An ordinary account
item.description: A long piece on transgender rights, in which I admit that I do have opinions on what social and political considerations a person such as myself deserves. The central claim is that transgender rights can be justified on their own terms, pragmatically, without requiring any recourse to strong metaphysical claims about the nature of gender identity.

item.title: Unnamed-chunk-16
item.description: The story of my preparations for my first rape trauma counselling session, told mostly in fits and starts

item.title: Eighty-three, sooner or later
item.description: A lot of content warnings on this one

item.title: Valentines day
item.description: An post about unpleasant things. Content warning for sexual assault.

item.title: Ain't I a woman?
item.description: Idle reflections on a question that I don’t think makes any sense, yet has so many real world consequences for me.

item.title: 52 pickup
item.description: A short, disjointed essay on the strangeness of being a trans woman in academia.
